message.content:
cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.PL, cs.LO, cs.SY. 

The paper proposes an extension of the Rebeca language for modelling distributed and asynchronous systems with timing constraints. This suggests that the paper could belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The paper also discusses the formal semantics of the language using Structural Operational Semantics, which could place it in the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category. Additionally, the paper mentions a tool for automated translation from timed Rebeca to the Erlang language, which could suggest a focus on Programming Languages (cs.PL). The paper also discusses simulation as an effective analysis support, which could place it in the Logic in Computer Science (cs.LO) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with real-time systems, which could suggest a focus on Systems and Control (cs.SY).
